Candidate :  Kamila Wacieg  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   France - Paris  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Ph.D. Centre for International Studies and Research (CERI), Sciences Po Paris - 03/2010 to 03/2014  
Political Science, Political Sociology and Public Policies Programme. Thesis: “Regional policies of 
decarbonisation in Europe from a comparative perspective. Case of Silesia in Poland and Nord -Pas-de-
Calais in France (2007 -2013). How do re gional authorities use European funding schemes to carry out 
the decarbonisation agenda?” under supervision of François Bafoil, distinction “très honorable avec 
félicitations du jury”  
 
Double Master Degree between the Institute of Political Sciences, Sciences Po Paris and London 
School of Economics - 10/2005 to 09/2007

Candidate :  Kamila Wacieg  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   France - Paris  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Ph.D. Centre for International Studies and Research (CERI), Sciences Po Paris - 03/2010 to 03/2014  
Political Science, Political Sociology and Public Policies Programme. Thesis: “Regional policies of 
decarbonisation in Europe from a comparative perspective. Case of Silesia in Poland and Nord -Pas-de-
Calais in France (2007 -2013). How do re gional authorities use European funding schemes to carry out 
the decarbonisation agenda?” under supervision of François Bafoil, distinction “très honorable avec 
félicitations du jury”  
 
Double Master Degree between the Institute of Political Sciences, Sciences Po Paris and London 
School of Economics - 10/2005 to 09/2007  
Selected for the programme out of two hundred applicants  
● MSc in International Political Economy (LSE, London) - 09/06 to 09/2007  
○ Final dissertation focusing on “The Influence of Ideas on Polish Economic Reforms in the 1990s” 
(Distinction)  
● Master in International Carriers (Sciences Po Paris) - 10/2005 to 06/2006  
○ Specialization in Development  
 
University of Sussex (Falmer, Brigthon, UK) - 09/2004 to 06/2005  
A Visiting and Exchange Student  
 
Institute of Political Sciences, Sciences Po (Dijon, France) - 09/2002 to 06/2004  
Specialization in Eastern European Countries (history and politics)  
 
French Ba ccalaureate, Charles de Gaulle European High School (Dijon, France) - 1999 to 2002  
Baccalaureate in Economics and Social Sciences with Honours (Mention Bien)  
 
Languages  
Polish  (Fluent )  
English (Fluent)  
French (Fluent)  
Spanish (Good)  
 
 
 CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
March 2014  to date Veolia Corporate  
 
July 2017 to date  
Position: Director, Energy and Climate within the Public Affairs Department (PAD ) 
In charge of coordinati ng and drafting the group’s position. Responsible for the following topics: air 
quality, renewable energies, biomass sustainability criteria, energy efficiency, energy performance 
contracting, cogeneration, energy efficiency and design of buildings, distri ct heating and cooling, 
hydrogen, carbon capture, storage and use, carbon removals, sustainable aviation fuels, renewable 
fuels of non biologic origin, electricity markets (aggregators), evolution of the EU ETS, Effort Sharing 
Regulation, Carbon Border Adj ustment Mechanism, EU funding instruments, the EU taxonomy, State 
Aid Rules, and issues related to circular economy (waste heat and waste to energy ). 
 
Jan 2015 – June 2017  
Position: Advisor to Director of the Public Affairs Departmen t 
Providing support to the Head of the Department, m ainly on energy and climate policies and strategies, 
and other relevant issues identified by the superviso r. 
 
March 2014 to D ec 2014  
Position: Policy Officer at the Public Affairs Department (PA D) 
In charge of climate and energy policy, institutional relations with the PAD partners, coor dination of 
networks of referents responsible for public affairs and public funds, and of coordination of the group’s 
access to European and national public funds (for projects in the field of water, waste ). 
 
Marc h 2010  to Dec 201 3 Dalkia Headquarter – CIFRE Contract  
Position : Research F ellow  
in charge of a long -term funding strategy (Euro pean and national public funds) for energy projects in 
Central Europe Division of Dalkia (part of Veolia ). 
 
Sept 2009 to Sept 2010 Nouvelle Consulting  
Position: Project Manager  
In charge of organisation of monthly events regarding new EU member states (on a voluntary basis ). 
 
Jan 2008  to March 2010  Nomadeis Consulting  
Position : Project Man ager 
In charge of a broad market intelligence contrac t with a leading global IT firm, for the production of five 
quarterly market reviews published on the firm’s WW intranet on the following subjects related to 
Information and Communication Technologies (ICT): in E -government, Healthcare, Defence, 
Education,  Pharma & Life Science s. 
 
March 2007 to Sept 2007 Alexander Lort Financial Recruitment Specialists  
Position: A ssistant to  the Executive Director  
 
July 2006 to Sept 2006 UNESCO
